content.title: Scratch Basics Quiz
content.description: Test your knowledge of basic Scratch concepts.

questions.question: Which area of the Scratch interface displays your running project?
questions.explanation: The Stage is the area in the top-right that shows your running project.

questions.question: Which block category contains movement-related commands?
questions.explanation: Motion blocks (colored blue) contain all movement-related commands for sprites.

questions.question: In Scratch, you can have multiple sprites in a single project.
questions.explanation: Yes, a Scratch project can contain multiple sprites, each with its own scripts.

questions.question: What happens when you click the green flag in Scratch?
questions.explanation: The green flag is used to start running the project, activating all scripts that begin with a 'when green flag clicked' block.

questions.question: Which of the following are ways to add a sprite in Scratch? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: You can add sprites from the library, paint them yourself, or upload images. There is no 'app store' in Scratch.
